author: Peter Blumberg
description: Former FBI Director James Comey was criminally indicted, according to the US Justice Department.
title: Former FBI Director James Comey Criminally Indicted in US

author: Philip Aldrick
description: Delivering the UK government’s pledge to lift defense spending to 3.5% of gross domestic product in a decade would fundamentally “reshape” the state and require cuts to other services equivalent to eliminating all spending on police, border force, courts and prisons, the Institute for Fiscal Studies said.
title: UK Defense Pledge to Fundamentally Alter British State, IFS Says

author: Derek Wallbank
description: President Donald Trump plans to impose a 25% tariff on heavy trucks starting Oct. 1.
title: US to Impose 25% Tariff on Heavy Truck Imports From Oct. 1

description: The indictment makes Comey the first former senior government official to face prosecution in connection with one of Trump’s chief grievances.
title: Ex-FBI Director Comey Charged With False Statement, Obstruction

author: Melissa Shin
description: Workers at Canada’s national postal company are on strike for the second time in less than a year, shutting down a delivery service for millions of households and businesses.
title: Postal Workers Strike in Canada as Government Plots Major Overhaul

author: Nick Wadhams
description: Much maligned, the world body has had a week in the spotlight to remember.
title: Thanks to Trump’s Attack, the UN Might Have Rediscovered a Voice

author: Lara Sanli, Georgi Azar
description: A top official in Yemen’s United Nations-backed government said Houthi militants who control much of the country can be defeated in six to twelve months with foreign support, potentially easing threats to key trade routes through the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden.
title: Yemen VP Says Houthis Can Be Defeated in Six to Twelve Months

author: Alex Wickham
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer will try to relaunch his stuttering administration with a speech Friday announcing a plan for compulsory digital identity cards to help combat illegal migration, while also making a progressive case for his premiership as it comes under threat from internal rivals.
title: UK to Introduce Mandatory Digital ID Cards in New Starmer Reset

author: Shruti Singh
description: A shrinking student body is the latest pain point for Chicago Public Schools as President Donald Trump’s policies raise fears among immigrant communities and put federal dollars at risk.
title: A Chicago Hit by ICE Raids Faces Declining Student Enrollment

author: John Micklethwait, Andrea Palasciano
description: Western militaries can’t keep shooting down incoming drones with expensive missiles, NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte said on Thursday, adding that NATO is rapidly learning from Ukraine on how to counter Russian drones.
title: Rutte Says NATO Can’t Afford to Down Drones With Pricey Missiles

author: Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump said he would not allow Israel to annex the West Bank, as Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu faces pressure from some members of his coalition to increase Israeli control over the region.
title: Trump Says He Will Not Allow Israel to Annex the West Bank

author: Alexandra S Levine, Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump advanced plans for American investors to buy TikTok’s US operations from its Chinese owner ByteDance Ltd., with officials setting a potential value of $14 billion and outlining measures to ensure security of the new venture.
title: Trump Signs TikTok Order With US App’s Value Put at $14 Billion

author: Julia Press, David Gura
description: On today’s Big Take podcast: President Trump and US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent have signaled plans to boost Argentina’s economy.
title: What’s Behind the White House’s Argentina Rescue Plan

author: Gregory Korte
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, domestic policy reporter Gregory Korte looks at the latest move by the Trump administration in the standoff over government funding. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Ups the Ante in Game of Shutdown Chicken With Democrats

author: Zoe Tillman, Erik Larson
description: Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook’s attorneys urged the US Supreme Court to let her stay on the job while she fights President Donald Trump’s attempt to fire her, warning that even her temporary removal risks “chaos and disruption” in financial markets.
title: Fed’s Cook Warns Supreme Court of Market ‘Chaos’ If She’s Fired

author: Erik Larson
description: Open Society Foundations, which was founded by George Soros, said that a federal criminal probe into its operations without evidence of wrongdoing would amount to the Trump administration abusing its power and threatening free speech.
title: Soros Nonprofit Says Potential DOJ Probe Would Stifle Speech

author: Eric Martin
description: The US is starting a campaign to revamp international asylum rules that it says are outdated and frequently abused, after President Donald Trump decried “the crisis of uncontrolled migration” during his speech at the United Nations this week.
title: US Pushes Overhaul of Global Asylum Rules After Trump Speech

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is considering adding certain symptoms of autism to an official list of side effects that can be compensated through a government vaccine injury program, according to an adviser.
title: RFK Jr. Mulls Adding Autism Symptoms to Vaccine Injury Program

author: Todd Gillespie
description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. President John Waldron criticized the growth of barriers to movement put up by countries around the world, amid rising concern among American firms about the Trump administration’s decision to charge $100,000 for a key type of visa.
title: Goldman President Criticizes Barriers to Migration Amid H-1B Row

author: Jeff Stone
description: Online extremists are rallying around President Donald Trump’s designation of Antifa as a domestic terrorist organization following conservative activist Charlie Kirk’s death, raising concerns that social media harassment could turn violent, according to researchers who track hate groups.
title: Hate Groups Seize on Trump’s Antifa Order With Online Threats

author: Stephan Kueffner
description: Ecuadoreans will vote in November on whether to rewrite the constitution, a step the government says is necessary to give it the tools to fight cocaine cartels and restore order.
title: Ecuador to Hold Referendum on Noboa Plan to Rewrite Constitution

author: Patrick Donahue, Andrea Palasciano, Alex Wickham
description: European diplomats warned the Kremlin this week that NATO is ready to respond to further violations of its airspace with full force, including by shooting down Russian planes, according to officials familiar with the exchange.
title: Europeans Privately Tell Russia They’re Ready to Shoot Down Jets

author: Lucy White
description: Reform UK Leader Nigel Farage accused the Bank of England of “appalling” conduct in its efforts to establish a digital pound for the UK, saying it represents an overreach of the state into citizens’ lives.
title: Farage Spars With Bank of England Over Plans for Digital Pound

author: Ellen Milligan
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer branded Donald Trump’s criticisms of London’s mayor as “ridiculous” in his most pointed criticism yet of the US president.
title: Starmer Defends London Mayor Against ‘Ridiculous’ Trump Critique

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump said his administration will use funds collected from tariffs to assist beleaguered US farmers, who have thus far been hit hard by his trade policies.
title: Trump Says Tariff Revenue Will Fund Relief for US Farmers

author: Anthony Capaccio, John Harney
description: Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth has summoned top military commanders for an unusual meeting early next week, just before US government might shut down over a funding dispute between President Donald Trump and congressional Democrats.
title: Hegseth Summons Top Military Officers to a Gathering Next Week

author: Erin Ailworth
description: US Agriculture Secretary Brooke Rollins said the US will investigate suppliers of crop inputs such as seeds and fertilizers for potential antitrust violations, sending share prices plunging.
title: US to Scrutinize Farm Input Suppliers on Cost Surge

description: Andrew Cuomo, former New York governor and New York City mayoral candidate, says he will be the only one left running against Zohran Mamdani. Cuomo says it's up to Republican nominee Curtis Sliwa and incumbent Mayor Eric Adams to decide whether they're dropping out. He speaks to Bloomberg's David Gura.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Cuomo: NYC Election Will Become Two-Person Race With Mamdani ‘No Matter What’

author: Andra Timu, Irina Vilcu
description: With a population of just 2.4 million and one of the smallest economies in Europe, Moldova barely registers by most European Union metrics. Yet the former Soviet republic wedged between EU member Romania and war-ravaged Ukraine has drawn outsized attention from the continent’s powerful democracies and Vladimir Putin’s Russia.
title: Why Russia and the EU Are Sparring Over Moldova

author: Georgia Hall, David Gura
description: Former Governor Andrew Cuomo blasted his rival Zohran Mamdani’s candidacy in the race for mayor of New York City as “abhorrent” and the competition as a “battle for the soul” of the Democratic party.
title: Cuomo Says NYC’s Mayoral Race Shows Democratic Party ‘Civil War’

author: Daryna Krasnolutska
description: Ukraine’s biggest oil and gas company is pitching several projects that could be among the first under a resource deal with the US to shore up its wartime economy and help secure support from President Donald Trump.
title: Ukraine Pitches First Energy Projects Under US Resources Pact

author: Kate Sullivan, Selcan Hacaoglu
description: President Donald Trump pressed Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan to stop buying oil from Russia and left the door open to Ankara obtaining F-35 fighter jets, as the leaders looked to resolve a number of longstanding issues that have strained ties between the NATO allies.
title: Trump Urges Erdogan to Cut Russia Oil Buys, Floats F-35 Deal

author: Natasha Voase
description: The UK needs to attract global talent to help support the Labour government’s growth mission, especially after the US raised visa fees for foreign workers, according to Britain’s Investment Minister Jason Stockwood.
title: UK Must Draw Talent After Trump’s H-1B Visa Move, Stockwood Says

author: Tyler Kendall, Dasha Afanasieva
description: Dutch Prime Minister Dick Schoof warned Russia over further incursions into NATO airspace, as the allies struggle to coordinate a response to Moscow’s escalating violations.
title: Dutch Premier Warns Russia Over Entering NATO Airspace

author: Joe Mayes
description: Keir Starmer’s head of communications quit 10 Downing Street, the latest exit from his top team during a rocky period for the UK prime minister.
title: Starmer’s Head of Comms Quits in Latest Exit From Downing Street

author: Steven T. Dennis, Erik Wasson
description: A fresh threat from President Donald Trump’s budget office of mass firings of federal workers if the government shuts down Oct. 1 incensed Democratic leaders and ramped up the political and economic stakes if lawmakers and the White House can’t reach a deal.
title: Trump Layoff Threat Raises Shutdown’s Political, Economic Stakes

author: Jacob Gu
description: Chinese Premier Li Qiang is meeting with executives from some major American companies Thursday on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly in New York, according to people familiar with the plan.
title: China Premier Li Meeting BlackRock, Citadel Leaders in New York

author: Erik Larson, Zoe Tillman
description: A bipartisan group of former Treasury secretaries, Federal Reserve Board chairs and other economic experts urged the US Supreme Court not to let President Donald Trump fire Fed Governor Lisa Cook over allegations of mortgage fraud.
title: Ex-Fed, Treasury Officials Back Cook in Supreme Court Job Fight

author: Foster Wong
description: China launched a trade barrier investigation into Mexico after the Latin American country announced plans to impose tariffs of as much as 50% on Chinese cars and other products.
title: China Launches Trade Barrier Probe Into Mexico Over Tariff Plan

author: Michael Nienaber
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz threw his backing behind a European Union plan to leverage frozen Russian assets to provide Ukraine with an interest-free loan of nearly €140 billion ($164 billion) to bolster its defense capabilities.
title: Merz Backs EU Plan for €140 Billion Interest-Free Ukraine Loan

author: Laura Noonan, Claudia Cohen
description: The head of France’s securities regulator dismissed concerns the country is facing a potential financial crisis after political instability triggered two credit downgrades within a week.
title: French Markets Watchdog Sees Country Dodging Financial Crisis

author: Christine Burke
description: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman ordered a freeze on rent increases in the capital of Riyadh for the next five years, just weeks after vowing to halt an “unacceptable” rise in property prices.
title: Saudi Arabia Orders Freeze on Rents in Riyadh After Price Surge

author: Jan Bratanic
description: Slovenia’s government has imposed a travel ban on Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who stands accused of war crimes and crimes against humanity, said State Secretary for the Foreign Ministry Neva Grasic, at a press conference in Ljubljana.
title: Slovenia Imposes Travel Ban on Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu

author: Caitlin Reilly, Erik Wasson
description: One of the most lucrative tax breaks corporate America won in Donald Trump’s signature economic legislation — worth an estimated $67 billion this year — is hitting a roadblock in a minimum tax Congress set three years ago under Democratic President Joe Biden.
title: Trump’s Corporate Tax Break Worth $67 Billion Hits a Snag

author: Kamailoudini Tagba
description: Mali suspended its counter-terrorism cooperation with France, days after its former colonial ruler said it’ll do the same following the arrest of a French envoy in Bamako.
title: Mali Hits Back at France By Ending Counter-Terrorism Cooperation

author: Michael Nienaber
description: German Defense Minister Boris Pistorius warned that Russia might deploy nuclear weapons in space, saying that Germany would spend billions to protect its satellites and that NATO allies should consider building “offensive capabilities” in orbit.
title: Germany Eyes ‘Offensive Capabilities’ in Space to Deter Russia

author: Ruchi Bhatia, Rakesh Sharma
description: Indian officials have again told the Trump administration that a significant reduction in Russian oil imports by the South Asian nation’s refiners would require Washington to instead allow crude purchases from sanctioned suppliers Iran and Venezuela.
title: India Asks US to Allow Iran Oil in Order to Curb Russia Trade

author: Beril Akman
description: It’s a big day for Turkey’s president — and for his world view.
title: Erdoğan Has a Long List of Asks for Trump Visit

author: Gaspard Sebag
description: Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy was convicted by Paris judges in a case into allegations his 2007 winning campaign was covertly funded by millions of euros from the late Moammar Qaddafi’s regime.
title: Sarkozy Found Guilty Over Libyan Cash Campaign Funding

author: Zoltan Simon
description: Donald Trump and Viktor Orban held a phone conversation a day after the US president said he would press the Hungarian premier to stop purchasing Russian oil.
title: Trump, Orban Talk Energy as US Bears Down on Russian Oil Buyers

author: Alex Wickham
description: Keir Starmer’s allies criticized rival Andy Burnham’s comments that he would increase government borrowing, warning that he risks spooking the bond market and becoming Labour’s Liz Truss.
title: Gilt Market Becomes Early Battleground for Starmer and Burnham

author: Anuchit Nguyen, Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand will take all possible measures to avert a sovereign credit rating downgrade, Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul said, a day after Fitch Ratings lowered the nation’s outlook citing rising risks to public finance.
title: Thai PM Vows Prudent Policy to Ward Off Ratings Downgrade

author: Ania Nussbaum
description: Marine Le Pen is seeking to exploit President Emmanuel Macron’s moment of weakness as his fifth premier in two years struggles to form a government.
title: Le Pen Turns Up Pressure on Macron With Push for French Election

author: Ram Anand, Anisah Shukry, Kok Leong Chan
description: Trade chief Maros Sefcovic said the European Union hopes to reach free trade agreements with Malaysia, the Philippines and Thailand before the 50th anniversary of the bloc’s relations with the Association of Southeast Asian Nations in 2027.
title: EU’s Sefcovic Seeks FTAs With Malaysia, Other Asean Nations Soon

author: Selcan Hacaoglu, Kate Sullivan
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is set to visit the White House for the first time in six years, bringing a slate of deals aimed at repairing the fractious ties between the two members of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.
title: Erdogan Visits Trump White House With $50 Billion Shopping List

author: Agnieszka Barteczko, Yian Lee
description: Poland has become the biggest buyer of drones from Taiwan as the Eastern European country, on Russia’s doorstep, bolsters its defense capabilities and seeks to reduce reliance on Chinese parts.
title: Poland Becomes Top Importer of Taiwanese Drones, Skirting China

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: India is weighing French-made engines for its fighter jets as talks over joint manufacturing with the US move at a sluggish pace, according to senior officials in New Delhi familiar with the matter.
title: India May Opt for French Fighter Jet Engines as US Talks Drag On

author: Tooba Khan
description: US President Donald Trump is scheduled to meet Pakistan’s Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif at the White House, the latest sign of improving ties between the two nations.
title: Trump to Meet Pakistan PM Sharif at White House as Ties Improve

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon, Ditas B Lopez
description: Allegations of widespread government corruption in flood infrastructure projects worth billions of dollars ignited mass protests across the Philippines on Sept. 21, intensifying pressure on President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. to implement sweeping reforms to root out a problem that has long plagued the Southeast Asian nation.
title: What’s Behind the Flood Corruption Scandal in the Philippines?

author: Ania Nussbaum
description: The CEO of BlackRock Inc., Larry Fink, has only good words for Emmanuel Macron.
title: BlackRock’s Fink Hails Macron’s ‘Bold Decisions’ at NYC Gala

author: Christian Wienberg, Sanne Wass
description: Denmark endured the second drone attack this week as authorities probe potential Russian involvement in the incidents and discuss how to involve NATO allies.
title: Denmark Investigates Potential Russia Link After Drone Attacks at Multiple Airports

author: Ignacio Olivera Doll
description: Argentina’s currency market is being flooded with dollars from grain purchases, prompting calls for the government to start rebuilding its stock of hard-currency reserves after selling more than $1 billion last week.
title: Milei’s Tax Cut on Crops Quickly Lures $7 Billion Into Argentina

author: Lauren Dezenski
description: The White House budget office is telling federal agencies to prepare plans for mass firings during a possible government shutdown.
title: White House Tells Agencies to Prepare for Job Cuts in Shutdown

author: Daniel Flatley, Eric Martin
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent praised Argentine President Javier Milei Wednesday night at a posh gala in New York on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly, saying he has “laid the foundation for a new golden age in Argentina.”
title: Bessent Lauds Milei at Midtown Gala as US Plans Argentina Rescue

author: Philip Glamann
description: China called on its companies doing business in the US to avoid extending their price wars there — a sign that Beijing is eager to maintain a fragile trade truce reached with Washington.
title: China Urges Its Companies to Avoid Taking Price Wars to the US

author: Angus Whitley
description: Australian Communications Minister Anika Wells summoned Singapore Telecommunications Ltd. to a meeting following a fatal outage at its Optus division, warning the blunder was likely to lead to major financial penalties.
title: SingTel Summoned by Australia as Penalty From Fatal Outage Looms

author: Swati Gupta, Dan Strumpf
description: Nepal’s wreckage serves as a warning to leaders ruling over young populations seething over unemployment and corruption.
title: How Angry Gen Z Kids Sparked Asia's Deadliest Protest This Year
